intro: Laetia guazumifolia var. tomentosa, commonly known as the tomentose laetia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, tomentose leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
